document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the leafhopper genus Thagria Melichar (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Coelidiinae) from Guangxi, China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
1 ♂
, CHINA : Guangxi, Pingxiang, Youyiguan,
1 June 1997
, coll. Yang Maofa;
5 ♂
, CHINA : Yunnan, Baoshan, Tengchong,
14–15 July 2002
, coll. Li Zizhong & Dai Renhuai;
3 ♂
, CHINA : Yunnan, Baoshan, Longling,
24 Aug. 2002
, coll. Li Zizhong;
12 ♂
, CHINA : Guizhou, Leigongshan,
31 July to 4 Aug. 2004
, coll. Xu Pian, Liao Qirong & Song Qiongzhang;
9 ♂
, CHINA : Guizhou, Daozhen, Dashahe,
17–20 Aug. 2004
, coll. Yang Maofa;
1 ♂
, CHINA : Guangxi, Damingshan,
22 July 2007
, coll. Zhang Yubo;
1 ♂
, CHINA : Guangxi, Laibin, Jinxiu, Changdong,
18 May 2009
, coll. Zheng Yanli;
3 ♂
, CHINA : Guizhou, Kuankuoshui,
10–13 Aug. 2010
, coll. Zhang Bin, Li Yujian & Song Qiongzhang;
6 ♂
, CHINA : Yunnan, Baoshan, Baihualing,
13–14 June 2011
, coll. Li Yujian & Long Jiankun;
2 ♂
, CHINA : Guizhou, Fanjingshan,
21 Sep. 2011
, coll. Fan Zhihua & Long Jiankun;
6 ♂
, CHINA : Guangxi, Chongzuo, Daxin, Detian,
11–12 May 2012
, coll. Fan Zhihua & Li Hu;
9 ♂
, CHINA : Hubei, Yichang, Wufenghouhe,
22–24 July 2013
, coll. Chang Zhimin & Xing Dongliang;
10 ♂
, CHINA : Yunnan, Dehong, Lianghe, Mengyang,
27 July 2013
, coll. Fan Zhihua & Yang Weicheng;
23 ♂
, CHINA : Hunan, Badagongshan,
2–6 Aug. 2013
, coll. Chang Zhimin, Li Hu, Xing Dongliang, Qu Ling & Wu Yunfei;
1 ♂
, CHINA : Yunnan, Gaoligongshan,
6 Aug. 2013
, coll. Sun Haiyan ( GUGC ).

Remarks. This species was placed in the genus by
Nielson ( 1977 )
, and described from the holotype (female) from BMNH . It is similar to
T. philagroides (Jacobi, 1914 )
,
T. bispina
Zhang, 1990
,
T. conica
Zhang, 1990
and
T. birama
Zhang, 1994
in external morphology. The style is bifurcate (
Fig. 221
), but differs in having three to four processes (
Figs. 209, 211–213
;
Nielson 1977
: 36 ,
Fig. 79
) in
T. philagroides
;
T. projecta
has the paraphysis without process (
Fig. 221
), but two basal processes are present in
T. bispina
(
Figs. 33, 36
); the ventral processes of segment X are short, with one small spine distally in
T. projecta
(
Fig. 218
), while in
T. conica
this pair of processes are long, slender, and pointed distally (
Fig. 54
); and the shape of the paraphysis, style and ventral processes of segment X are different in both
T. birama
and
T. projecta
(
Figs. 21, 23
, 219, 221 ).
